items.title: Are free radicals really that bad for you?
items.summary: Free radicals are highly reactive molecules that are missing an electron. They get a bad rap, but could they actually have any benefits?

items.title: England taken apart as brutal Head gives Australia opening Ashes win
items.summary: England go down to a humbling defeat in the first Ashes Test after Travis Headâ€™s blistering century completes an astonishing Australia fightback in Perth.

items.title: 'Top class' - Head scores century as  Australia beat England
items.summary: Travis Head reaches his tenth Test century off just 69 balls as Australia beat England inside two days in the first Ashes Test in Perth.

items.title: Noakes goes from railways and roofing to Riyadh title shot
items.summary: Sam Noakes has run marathons on a whim and was moved to stop his mother from contacting past opponents - now he fights for the WBO lightweight title.

items.title: Scotland fans caused 'small earthquake' in World Cup qualifier win
items.summary: Seismic activity was recorded as the Tartan Army celebrated Scotland reaching their first World Cup since 1998.

items.title: A look around Barcelona's new-look Nou Camp
items.summary: BBC Spanish football reporter Elizabeth Conway shows us around Barcelona's iconic Nou Camp. The stadium will reopen, after more than two years of renovation work, for a game against Athletic Club in La Liga on Saturday.

items.title: Nice guy Edwards out to prove he won't finish last with Wolves
items.summary: After 111 appearances as a player for Wolves, news manager Rob Edwards takes charge against Crystal Palace with the club battling for their Premier League lives.

items.title: 'Where has this come from?' - Pope, Brook & Root dismissed
items.summary: Scott Boland and Mitchell Starc take the three wickets of Ollie Pope, Harry Brook and Joe Root in the space of six balls as England fall to 76-5 on day two of the first Ashes Test in Perth.

items.title: Logitech Promo Code: $25 Off This Holiday Season
items.summary: Get an exclusive discount of $25 off $200+ this holiday season when you sign up for Logitech emails.

items.title: Why it was always Arsenal for 'part-time barista' Saka
items.summary: England winger Bukayo Saka sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about his love for Arsenal and living in his "coffee era".

items.title: North London derby is one of most beautiful games - Saka
items.summary: Bukayo Saka shares what it was like growing up as an Arsenal fan and what the north London derby means to him.

items.title: Total Wireless Promo Codes & Deals: 50% Off Select Plans
items.summary: Find great deals for Total Wireless, like 50% off select plans, and enjoy big savings.

items.summary: The musical adaptation's second and final instalment is 'emotionally soaring'

items.title: Medieval spear pulled from Polish lake may have belonged to prince or nobleman
items.summary: Four medieval spearheads have been found in Lake Lednica in Poland. One may have belonged to a nobleman or prince.

items.title: New 'Transformer' humanoid robot can launch a shapeshifting drone off its back â€” watch it in action
items.summary: Developed at Caltech, a new robot is a humanoid that can launch an M4 drone, switching between different modes of motion, with wheels that can become rotors.

items.title: How Seven reflected the US's 1980s fears
items.summary: David Fincher's thriller comments on urban decay in the conservative Reagan era

items.title: Extreme bloom of toxic algae swirls in Nevada's 'Pyramid Lake' â€” Earth from space
items.summary: A 2024 satellite photo shows an unusually active bloom of toxic cyanobacteria swirling in the water of Nevada's Pyramid Lake. Research suggests that the algae has been blooming there for at least 9,000 years.

items.title: 'It felt like God's hand on my brain' - the day England were humbled by teenager
items.summary: BBC Sport's From The Ashes series concludes with the inside story of Ashton Agar's record-breaking introduction to Test cricket as a 19-year-old batting at number 11.

items.title: 'Sophisticated' Bronze Age city unearthed in Kazakhstan 'transforms our understanding of steppe societies'
items.summary: Archaeologists in Kazakhstan have discovered the "City of Seven Ravines," a vast Bronze Age "proto-city" with metalworking, dwellings and a large building.

items.title: 'Perfectly preserved' Neanderthal skull bones suggest their noses didn't evolve to warm air
items.summary: An analysis of the only intact Neanderthal inner nose bones known to exist reveals that our ancient cousins' enormous noses did not evolve to withstand harsh climates.

items.title: Watch live: New images of comet 3I/ATLAS revealed by NASA today (Nov. 19)
items.summary: NASA will finally share long-awaited images of interstellar object 3I/ATLAS taken during the comet's close flyby of Mars. A live stream has been set for today (Nov. 19).

items.title: Three more Chinese astronauts are now stranded in space following successful rescue of their colleagues
items.summary: The Shenzhou-21 crew has been marooned on China's Tiangong space station after three of their colleagues were brought back to Earth in the wrong spacecraft. For now, the astronauts have no safe way of returning home.

items.title: Mars orbiter narrows down the exact path of interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS by 'ten-fold,' surprising scientists
items.summary: Scientists from the European Space Agency have significantly narrowed down the trajectory of the interstellar visitor 3I/ATLAS thanks to data from the alien comet's recent flyby of Mars, allowing for more accurate future observations.

items.title: High-fiber diet may 'rejuvenate' immune cells that fight cancer, study finds
items.summary: A laboratory study reveals an interaction between dietary fiber and the gut microbiome that may be helpful for fighting cancer.

items.title: 'Nothing but a nightmare': Worker ants are tricked into murdering their mom by an imposter queen â€” who quickly takes the throne for herself
items.summary: A sneaky spray of chemicals makes ant workers turn on their own mother â€” the queen â€” so a parasitic invader can take over the colony herself.

items.title: A gulf separating Africa and Asia is still pulling apart â€” 5 million years after scientists thought it had stopped
items.summary: The Arabian and African tectonic plates failed to pull apart 28 million years ago at the Gulf of Suez, but the area hasn't stopped rifting.

items.title: The more that people use AI, the more likely they are to overestimate their own abilities
items.summary: Researchers found that AI flattens the bell curve of a common principle in human psychology, known as the Dunning-Kruger effect, giving us all the illusion of competence.
